Blog.post: The relationship between human and dog is incredible. Think about it. Take two species of carnivore, both of whom can kill the other with relative ease, put them together and make the best of friends out of them. Its fucking wierd. Its pretty much the same for cats but at no time have I ever feared for my life when in the presence of one. Then you take the mother dog who raises a kitten as her own. Or the dog who dies to save its master. What you end up with is a damned perplexing situation. When I was growing up we had a cat that was born with no eyes. No shit, it had no eyes; they opened but all that was there was meat. This cat was the neatest thing you ever saw. It could go out in the desert and catch its own food (squirrels and rabbits and things), it could navigate an entire four bedroom home with all it's furniture sporting hundreds of legs. Anyway, this cat could pretty much take care of itself but it had a tendency to roam in the street. That's where the dog comes in... Rusty was a springer spaniel and he was old when we got Tiger. Neither blindness nor deafness nor arthritis could stop that dog from going out into the street, picking up that cat by the scruff of the neck and bringing it back into the yard. One day we found out what Rusty was doing. Evidently the cat had taken to climbing up into the engine compartment of a neighbor's car. That day, the cat was outside and Rusty wasn't. Rusty lived to be about sixteen; he had gone almost completely blind and deaf and could barely move but had Tiger been around, I'm quite positive that Rusty would have cared for that cat til the day he died. Good Boy, Rusty.
